meanings.sent1: In the school competitions, students showed their skills.
meanings.sent2: The competitions at the fair were exciting to watch.
meanings.sent3: During the spelling bee competition, the words seemed to dance around the stage.
meanings.sent4: The fierce competition in the race made the air crackle with energy.
meanings.sent5: Competitions can bring out the best in people, pushing them to do their utmost.

meanings.definition: A contest or rivalry between individuals or groups
meanings.sent1: The basketball competitions between the two teams were intense.
meanings.sent2: Competitions like these often bring out the competitive spirit in everyone.
meanings.sent3: The pie-eating competition turned into a messy but hilarious event.
meanings.sent4: The competitions between the siblings for the last cookie were always amusing.
meanings.sent5: The fierce competitions between the companies led to innovative solutions.

meanings.definition: The activity or condition of striving to gain or win something by defeating or establishing superiority over others
meanings.sent1: The fierce competitions for the top spot were evident in every round.
meanings.sent2: Competitions like these drive individuals to improve and excel.
meanings.sent3: The competition for the best costume at the party was a fun challenge.
meanings.sent4: In the world of business, competitions can be as intense as a battlefield.
meanings.sent5: The competitions for scholarships motivated students to work hard and succeed.
